title: With external tool, if password contains a comma, the comma acts as a divider and the variable get split - 1.78.2.3228
author: Alessio71
body_snippet:
1.78.2.3228

With external tool, if password contains a comma, the comma acts as a divider and the variable get split.
If I have a password 123456789, the comma is just omitted, if I have a password 1234,56789 the external tool receives two strings, divided in two, one 1234 and the other 56789
To test it, create a .cmd file that echoes the %Password% 1234,56789
```
@echo off
echo "%1%"
echo "%2%"
pause
```
and pass %Password% to it, the `echo "%2%"` should give a `"" ` result if working normally...

iterations.description: PR #3109 - ProcessStart argument hardening and shell escaping for comma/semicolon

Alessio71 tested v1.79.0 (build 3387): issue still present. Batch .cmd file splits password on comma. Provided repro steps with test.cmd echoing %1% %2%.
Acknowledged .cmd batch edge case. Comma-splitting in batch arguments not fully addressed by PR #3109 escaping. Fix being reworked.

notes: ITERATION EXAMPLE: Fix applied (PR #3109) -> user tested -> still broken for .cmd batch files -> re-opened. Batch .cmd files handle commas differently than direct process invocation. Need to wrap password in double-quotes when passing to .cmd scripts, or use ProcessStartInfo with ArgumentList instead of Arguments string.
